summary:
Peter Q: Did it hurt...
Gamora: Did what hurt?
Peter Q: When you fell from heaven?
Gamora: Uh no, but I was thrown off a cliff...
body:
Peter Q: Did it hurt…

Gamora: Did what hurt?

Peter Q: When you fell from heaven?

Gamora: Uh no, but I was thrown off a cliff by my father, who adopted me, for a stone.

Peter Q:….

Gamora: I didn’t feel pain.

UPCOMING IMAGINES: Doctor Strange, Jack Frost, Thor

title: #142: Clint Barton x Reader
body:
Thanks for requesting anon ❤

Tag List: @underworldsheiress
Add yourself to the Tag List

Request: Could you please do an imagine with Clint Barton? Prompts 65, 196 and 91?

  • 65. “STOP INTERRUPTING ME!”
  • 91. “Don’t be alarmed. I’m going to kiss you.”
  • 196. “I’m yours, in every way you’ll have me.”

Prompt List

Rules for requesting.

“I’m yours, in every way you’ll have me.” That was the promise you and Clint had made to each other when your relationship started. You knew it wasn’t going to be easy, being that half your lives were dedicated to S.H.I.E.L.D. and the Avengers, but you had faith you could make it work. You expected to be stretched thin on days where you were under immense world saving levels of stress, but it was on days when you and Clint found downtime with the other Avengers that you had to remind yourself to stay calm at all times.

The men on the team were absolute children. You couldn’t get through a normal day without at least two of them bickering over something competent adults would normally ignore, and you were the unfortunate witness to the first squabble of the day.

“STOP INTERRUPTING ME!” Tony shouted at Clint, who was insisting he hadn’t broken the coffee machine. Tony was always on edge beneath the sarcastic facade, but when he didn’t have his coffee, it was a whole other story.

“It’s not my fault you can’t build a good Keurig knockoff!” Clint snapped at him.

“I can’t wait for retirement,” you muttered as you rubbed your temples. It was too early in the morning for this.

“I HAVE FIVE BUSINESS MEETINGS TODAY, ROBIN HOOD!” Tony was still yelling.

“You’re not going to show up to any of them!”

“THAT’S BESIDES THE POINT!”

“Calm down, boys,” you said, finally deciding it was a good time to try and deescalate the situation. You went over to the coffee machine and started checking all the possible things that could keep it from working. It was plugged in. It had enough water. What could be wrong with it?

You lifted the tab where the little coffee ground insert would go, and you sighed in disappointment at your coworkers.

“Tony, you never put the coffee in,” you told him. His angry expression turned to one of embarrassment, and he rubbed the back of his neck in shame.

“I knew that,” he said as you put in the coffee grounds for him.

“Sure you did.” You finished making his coffee and handed him his mug. “You’re welcome.”

“Thanks,” he said sheepishly, and headed out of the kitchen towards his lab.

“Don’t be alarmed,” Clint said as he embraced you from behind. “I’m going to kiss you.”

“I think I deserve more than that for diffusing another fight with Tony,” you said as he pressed soft kisses to your neck.

“What did you have in mind?” he asked.

“Breakfast in bed sounds nice.”

“Anything you want, baby,” he said, already at the stove. You sat at the island in the kitchen and watched him make your favorite breakfast, happy to savor this small moment of peace in the chaos of your heroic lives.

Buy me a coffee?

summary:
@hewastheirfriendd: shuri/mj + forehead kisses hope you like it! „Look,
I drew your reaction from the prank yesterday,“ MJ says,...
body:
@hewastheirfriendd: shuri/mj + forehead kisses

hope you like it!

„Look, I drew your reaction from the prank yesterday,“ MJ says, holding up her sketchbook to Peter.

Shuri laughs as he makes a grimace and looks at the picture herself.

„That’s not fair. You guys told me that we would prank T'Challa. Instead you pranked me.”

“I think the picture is very accurate,” Shuri says, taking the sketchbook out of MJ’S hands and holding it directly next to his head. “Basically twins.”

Peter snorts and swats it away. “You suck.”

“Says the guy who is named Spiderman and yet scared of spiders,” MJ says, pouting and patting Peter’s shoulder.

Peter’s cheeks turn hot while the girls laugh. “God, I shouldn’t have introduced you to each other.”

“Too late,” MJ says, putting her arm around Shuri. “She is mine now.”

Shuri just laughs.

“You two are the worst.” Peter glances at the clock. “Oh damn, I gotta run. I promised Ned that we would go see Jurassic World.”

“Have fun at your date!” Shuri shouts after him before turning to MJ. “Netflix and ice cream?”

“Hell yeah.”

-

They lie on the couch, limbs wrapped into each other, empty bowls on the ground.

“I feel like I can never move again,” MJ says, holding her stomach.

“Are you saying that there is something like too much ice cream?”

“Oh, I’d never dare, princess.”

Shuri throws a pillow at her. “Stop calling me that.” Then she raises her brows. “Don’t you think ‘queen’ would be more fitting?”

“Oh, of course, my majesty,” MJ says with a small grin, throwing the pillow right back.

Then they both look back on the film playing.

“Why does the guy want to kill everyone again?” Shuri asks, frowning.

“Because he is a poor, bullied white boy?”

They laugh as Shuri shuts off the TV. “Scary.”

“Really scary,” MJ replies, getting up and offering Shuri her hand. “My queen?”

“Oh, why thank you, fair lady,” Shuri answers with a smile, taking her hand.

They go the bedroom, change into pajamas and then slip under the blanket. They lie on their sides, looking at each other.

“You know, Peter is right. We wouldn’t have met without him,” Shuri says, shuffling a bit closer.

MJ just rolls her eyes. “Please never let him hear that or his ego will blow up.”

Shuri can’t help but giggle. “Promise.” Then she holds up her arm. MJ scoots to her, cuddling into her side.

“Also, if you ever tell him that I’m the small spoon, I will kill you.”

Shuri just grins and pulls her closer, pressing a kiss to her forehead. “Good night.”

“Promise first.”

“Okay. Promise.”

MJ nods, content, and closes her eyes. “Good night, my majesty.”

With a smile Shuri closes her eyes too. “Good night, fair lady.”

Also how on point do I have to be that my part 27 has 2727 words???

MASTERLIST

Pairing: oc x Bucky (first person)

Warnings: Strong language, violence, mentions of gore

Word count: 2727

Summary: Dawn’s incredible talent for attracting trouble catches up to her yet again, but this time, it might be more than she ever bargained for…

I hadn’t been able to get sleep last night. Every time I closed my eyes, I was thrown into a weird vision again, including the one my mysterious wound had triggered. It was always the same five settings, and yet, I still had no idea what they were.

It was like they were right out of reach. Every time I tried to cross the fog to discover what it was about, I was pulled out of my sleep. All I could get were five strong, different emotions proper to each vision. Joy, sorrow, renew, pain, and urgency. Oh, and one, single name.

Bucky.

It wasn’t a coincidence, and I knew it. But when I tried to see this through while awake, it would hurt my head, like I wasn’t supposed to access it despite the little part of me that pushed restlessly for it.

“I know you didn’t want that for her”

Those words were replaying in loop in my head, and I couldn’t help but link them to my vision. I hadn’t twitched yesterday, but I certainly picked up on it. What did he mean by that? Was it true that I knew them before? Was Stark right?

I hadn’t been called yet this morning, so I was left even more pondering about that. I was sitting on the edge of my stall, my weapons strapped on me, ready to go.

I had to think about it however for my screen to light up with Jonathan’s face on it.

“Soldier” He greeted. “Barnes is coming, fast. And he’s not alone”

I stood up and straightened my back. “What do you need me to do?” I asked.

“Go to the second basement and wait for him” He ordered. “I know Stark will have had the building scanned and will instruct Barnes to go find you there”

“And then?” I raised an eyebrow. “What do I do with him? Do I attack?”

“You stall him until I can’t get down there” He replied.

“Copy”

I grabbed my assault rifle and made sure my favourite blade was in my utility belt holster. I was already in the first basement, so I only walked the few feet separating me from the staircase and got one floor down. It was a wide, empty hangar with a few garages in them.

I went to the one that could be closed with enforced steel doors and waited for some company to arrive, gun in hand, ready to shoot. I had no idea what to expect from that famous Sergeant Barnes, even if Jonathan told me he wouldn’t hurt me. I chased every doubt I had and focused on the mission at hand. I couldn’t afford another failure.

I didn’t have to wonder what would happen for too long, because footsteps were suddenly coming my way. There was only one person coming, however. It must be him. The metal arm gave the man’s identity away when he stepped in the garage.

Barnes stopped when he saw me, like he couldn’t believe what he was seeing. He jogged toward me, and my eyes widened. It wasn’t fear, not even after I’ve heard of everything he’s done. It was the wave of familiarity that hit me upon seeing him. I knew that man, and I couldn’t stop the name from escaping my lips.

“Bucky?”

It was muffled and distorted, but he had heard, halting his steps.

“Dawn” He breathed, like he was taken aback. He took several more steps forward, but still left a safe distance between us.

I had no idea why I knew he was Bucky, or why him calling me Dawn felt right. Images tugged at the corner of my mind and tried to come out, but it only created chaos in my head.

“Why do I know you?” I frowned, trying to get a grip on myself. I was getting frustrated with these dead ends.

“You saved me from Hydra, do you remember?” He asked tentatively, taking one more step forward. “Stopped them from taking me back”

My knees buckled when images flew past the fog and flashed in my vision. Images of fighting, kicking off a pod from a metal arm, flipping a bike into black clad agents. I had been desperate to get him out of there.

I lifted my gun and he held up his hands in surrender. I had to get my head back in the task.

“You don’t wanna do this” He warned.

“I do actually” I threw my gun on the ground and closed the distance. I threw a punch, but he saw me coming and dodged it. I then kicked and punched again, and he still only dodged. Never had he tried to reply to my attacks, and I was getting angry. I accelerated my attacks, and he only escalated to push me back and elbowing me in the stomach when I was overwhelming him. I went in for another punch, but he grabbed my wrist with his metal arm and twisted it enough to constrict me.

“Listen to me” He breathed. “You took a bullet in the chest on your very first mission, but you didn’t die” He kept on talking, and the burning sensation in my lungs came back. Blood, pain, to protect a briefcase.

“Shut up” I flinched and rolled away from his grip as it weakened momentarily. I went back at him, trying to keep my anger in check. Jonathan wanted him alive. But I wouldn’t let him off easy, and I pushed hard enough to force him to fight back. We exchanged kicks and punches, even if his were voluntarily weak and indirect. He didn’t give me a lot of openings, but I finally managed to grab his throat and slam him down on the concrete. He struggled against my hold, but I held on.

“Dawn” He choked out as he gave up trying to get out. We locked eyes, and somehow I couldn’t look away. “I know you’re in there. Please come back to me”

My internal battle hit me back ten folds. I could read every emotion in his eyes like a clear order. He was pleading and desperate, but not for his life. His stare was searching mine, those icy blue eyes I could have sworn I’ve seen before. My fingers slowly released the grip on his throat before I could stop it. Barnes saw the opportunity and pushed me off while rolling away from me.

I was thrown off, but it wasn’t that hard like I knew he could. I landed on my feet and shakily stood up, not looking up at him. He too was on his feet, and he wasn’t making any move to attack me. My mask was in his hands right before he dropped it at his feet.

My head was buzzing louder than ever, and I had to shake my head to just hear above it. I knew Jonathan’s men were coming, that it would be over soon, but another part of me pushed to know more, insisting the buzzing would stop only if I got through it.

No, the mission. I had to stall.

But those visions weren’t leaving me alone.

But orders are orders. Wound him!

I had to rush my decision process, but I made my choice nonetheless. I grabbed my gun in my thigh holster, aimed and shot.

The bullet flew right past Bucky’s shoulder and lodged itself in the button to make the doors close. He jumped back in fear of my quick reaction, but his eyes widened in disbelief when the heavy doors began to slide shut. James’s angry face was the last thing I saw before the doors shut us from the outside.

I wanted to know more. Scratch that, I had to know more. The push was becoming stronger, and I wanted my headaches to end.

“Dawn?” He inquired with concern.

“Shut up!” I yelled out of instinct before shaking my head. This time, I couldn’t contain the part of me resisting that pull. I would regret doing this; I don’t even know why I deviated my shot to lock us up in here. I’d have a lot of explaining to Jonathan if I didn’t want to suffer the consequences.

He took one careful step, despite my gun aiming at him once again. My finger was on the trigger, ready to shoot. “You were on the streets, stealing. I brought you to the Avengers. You became my trainee” He took one more step.

“Lies!” I roared. “You’re a liar. That’s what you do”

"I’m not lying, you know it” His tone was softly shedding its softness and became more insistent. “You know me”

“I don’t!” I forced myself to hold his glance even though that part of me screamed to believe him. I knew better, he’d kill me if I let him win.

“What’s my name then?” He got even closer.

I stopped the first name on my lips from coming. “James Barnes”

“No, it’s not” His voice took a dangerous edge. “Say it”

“You’re Bucky” I said as the curious side of my mind came back kicking. It was like a war in my head, and I wanted it to be over.

“Yes, and who are you?” He asked again.

“No one” I seethed as anger sparked in me again. “I don’t have a name. I’m an asset”

“Your name is Da–”

“Stop it with that name” I interrupted him by trying to throw a punch at his face. His metal arm shot up yet again and easily grabbed my wrist. I trashed around, but this time, his hold didn’t waver.

“Your name is Dawn. Your parents died when you were 16” He kept going on anyway.

I flinched as more flashes attacked my vision. Spanish essay. Policemen. Bad news. Excruciating sadness.

“Stop” I pleaded as a heavy feeling took over me. Like my lungs were compressed.

“You need to snap out of it” He ordered. “I need you. Rose needs you”

I froze as the name echoed over in over again in my mind.

My sister.

I was thrown once again into my visions defiling one by one in my head, but this time, they were clear as crystal and detailed.

The birth of my sister.

The night my parents died.

The day I met Bucky.

The feeling of the bullet tearing through my lung.

Bucky and I’s last mission.

My eyes shot open as a torrent of information hit me all at once. All my senses went to overdrive as I lost my footing, slipping out of Bucky’s grip. I was hearing everything in the hangar, from the water dropping from the leaking pipe to Bucky’s heavy breathing. I shut my eyes to stop the light from attacking my eyes and I crawled until my back hit a wall.

All the pain from the previous months until Reeves erased my memory.

The starvation, the shocks, the torture.

It all came and went like my memory had been transformed into a roulette. So many chunks from these last years came and went so quickly, I couldn’t even focus on anything but pain. Despite this, I got to manage my breathing, and slowly opened my eyes. Bucky was standing there, looking concerned and afraid.

He came back.

“Dawn?” He asked tentatively.

“Buck” I forced a smile as I let my head fall back on the wall. He came back. It was really him, or so I hoped. Many times I had imagined that moment, but he was too clear to be a trick of my mind. It had to be real.

He didn’t waste time rushing to me and kneeling at my side. “I’m so sorry”

“For what?” I asked. I hated to see him blame himself.

“For not coming sooner” He replied.

“You’re an idiot to have ever come at all” I breathed, now feeling exhausted. I wanted to go to sleep for a whole week.

“I might be” He smiled slightly, pushing a loose strand of hair behind my ear.

“You know they’re waiting behind the door, right?” I said. “None of us will come out ourselves from here”

“Everybody is here, they will back us up–”

“It won’t be enough” I shook my head. “If Reeves gets to one of us, it’s game over. You shouldn’t have come back for me. Now we’re both screwed” I closed my eyes again.

“I made you a promise a while ago, when you were high on pain meds” He started. “I promised I would always have your back. And as far as I know, this counts as having your back”

I opened my eyes again and looked into his. There was worry, and relief. Weariness, but a spark of energy still kicking. This wasn’t him giving up on himself for me; it was him being determined to bring me back home. With him.

Wow, that’s must be what I was looking like when I got him out of trouble last time. Now I understood his point of view, I think. So I wouldn’t let him drag me out of here without doing my part. No, Reeves wouldn’t get him, he wouldn’t get either one of us.

And there was only one way of making sure of it.

“I may have an idea to get out of here” I spoke slowly. “But you won’t like it very much”

“Say it, because I don’t have a better plan” Bucky sighed.

I took a deep breath and looked down at my hands. “It’s one simple sentence”

Understanding instantly flashed in his eyes as he furiously shook his head. “No” He refused. “I will not re-activate you. Never”

“That’s the only way” I argued as I looked up at him.

“No, we’ll find something else” He tried to compromise. “You just snapped out of it. You are exhausted, and still confused. If you were to be…” He paused and gulped, something close to panic in his eyes. “It could damage even more your mind”

“Bucky” I reached to his face and placed my palm on his cheek. I knew it would mess up even more my brain, and I had no idea when I’d snap out of it again. “It’s either you do it, or they do it. And I’d much rather see you do it, than them”

He squeezed his eyes shut and played his hand on top of mine. He took deep breath, before finally nodding and handing me his phone. “Show me” He said reluctantly.

I took the phone and wrote the words. Just thinking about them made my hands shake, and I just hoped I’d be done soon. I gave him the cell phone back and he stood up, then helped me on my feet too. He took one step back, and I didn’t dare to look away from him. I didn’t want to do this, I really didn’t, but I had no choice and I trusted him.

“Are you sure?” He asked as gunshots and yells could be heard outside.

“No” I muttered. “But do it. Do it now”

He quickly debated if he should do it, but an explosion sound made up his mind. “When dusk comes the warrior has fallen, but the soldier rises to meet its salvation”

It hit me like a truck, so hard that I had to take a knee. All shaking in my limbs stopped as I pushed myself back on my feet, then slowly looked up at the man in front of me. He was familiar, but I couldn’t place him.

It didn’t matter, he was my handler.

“Soldier?” The pain was quickly wiped from his face and a stoic expression replaced it.

“Ready to comply” I replied.

“Get us out of here alive” He ordered as he walked toward the two discarded guns on the ground. “Shoot anyone who tries to stop us”

I nodded as he offered me the guns. I grabbed them, put the smallest one in my holster and kept the rifle in my hands. I walked to the control panel and rebooted the system. The doors opened automatically when it was done, and I lifted my gun to be ready. My handler did the same thing as about five dozens of guns were pointed our way.

They were ready to take me down, but so was I.

Bucky.

Those words were replaying in loop in my head, and I couldn’t help but link them to my vision. I hadn’t twitched yesterday, but I certainly picked up on it. What did he mean by that? Was it true that I knew them before? Was Stark right?

I hadn’t been called yet this morning, so I was left even more pondering about that. I was sitting on the edge of my stall, my weapons strapped on me, ready to go.

I had to think about it however for my screen to light up with Jonathan’s face on it.

“Soldier” He greeted. “Barnes is coming, fast. And he’s not alone”

I stood up and straightened my back. “What do you need me to do?” I asked.

“Go to the second basement and wait for him” He ordered. “I know Stark will have had the building scanned and will instruct Barnes to go find you there”

“And then?” I raised an eyebrow. “What do I do with him? Do I attack?”

“You stall him until I can’t get down there” He replied.

“Copy”

I couldn’t afford another failure.

“Bucky?”

It was muffled and distorted, but he had heard, halting his steps.

“Dawn” He breathed, like he was taken aback. He took several more steps forward, but still left a safe distance between us.

I had no idea why I knew he was Bucky, or why him calling me Dawn felt right. Images tugged at the corner of my mind and tried to come out, but it only created chaos in my head.

“Why do I know you?” I frowned, trying to get a grip on myself. I was getting frustrated with these dead ends.

“You saved me from Hydra, do you remember?” He asked tentatively, taking one more step forward. “Stopped them from taking me back”

My knees buckled when images flew past the fog and flashed in my vision. Images of fighting, kicking off a pod from a metal arm, flipping a bike into black clad agents. I had been desperate to get him out of there.

I lifted my gun and he held up his hands in surrender. I had to get my head back in the task.

“You don’t wanna do this” He warned.

“I do actually” I threw my gun on the ground and closed the distance. I threw a punch, but he saw me coming and dodged it. I then kicked and punched again, and he still only dodged. Never had he tried to reply to my attacks, and I was getting angry. I accelerated my attacks, and he only escalated to push me back and elbowing me in the stomach when I was overwhelming him. I went in for another punch, but he grabbed my wrist with his metal arm and twisted it enough to constrict me.

“Listen to me” He breathed. “You took a bullet in the chest on your very first mission, but you didn’t die” He kept on talking, and the burning sensation in my lungs came back. Blood, pain, to protect a briefcase.

“Shut up” I flinched and rolled away from his grip as it weakened momentarily. I went back at him, trying to keep my anger in check. Jonathan wanted him alive. But I wouldn’t let him off easy, and I pushed hard enough to force him to fight back. We exchanged kicks and punches, even if his were voluntarily weak and indirect. He didn’t give me a lot of openings, but I finally managed to grab his throat and slam him down on the concrete. He struggled against my hold, but I held on.

“Dawn” He choked out as he gave up trying to get out. We locked eyes, and somehow I couldn’t look away. “I know you’re in there. Please come back to me”

My internal battle hit me back ten folds. I could read every emotion in his eyes like a clear order. He was pleading and desperate, but not for his life. His stare was searching mine, those icy blue eyes I could have sworn I’ve seen before. My fingers slowly released the grip on his throat before I could stop it. Barnes saw the opportunity and pushed me off while rolling away from me.

I was thrown off, but it wasn’t that hard like I knew he could. I landed on my feet and shakily stood up, not looking up at him. He too was on his feet, and he wasn’t making any move to attack me. My mask was in his hands right before he dropped it at his feet.

My head was buzzing louder than ever, and I had to shake my head to just hear above it. I knew Jonathan’s men were coming, that it would be over soon, but another part of me pushed to know more, insisting the buzzing would stop only if I got through it.

No, the mission. I had to stall.

But those visions weren’t leaving me alone.

But orders are orders. Wound him!

I had to rush my decision process, but I made my choice nonetheless. I grabbed my gun in my thigh holster, aimed and shot.

The bullet flew right past Bucky’s shoulder and lodged itself in the button to make the doors close. He jumped back in fear of my quick reaction, but his eyes widened in disbelief when the heavy doors began to slide shut. James’s angry face was the last thing I saw before the doors shut us from the outside.

I wanted to know more. Scratch that, I had to know more. The push was becoming stronger, and I wanted my headaches to end.

“Dawn?” He inquired with concern.

“Shut up!” I yelled out of instinct before shaking my head. This time, I couldn’t contain the part of me resisting that pull. I would regret doing this; I don’t even know why I deviated my shot to lock us up in here. I’d have a lot of explaining to Jonathan if I didn’t want to suffer the consequences.

He took one careful step, despite my gun aiming at him once again. My finger was on the trigger, ready to shoot. “You were on the streets, stealing. I brought you to the Avengers. You became my trainee” He took one more step.

“Lies!” I roared. “You’re a liar. That’s what you do”

"I’m not lying, you know it” His tone was softly shedding its softness and became more insistent. “You know me”

“I don’t!” I forced myself to hold his glance even though that part of me screamed to believe him. I knew better, he’d kill me if I let him win.

“What’s my name then?” He got even closer.

I stopped the first name on my lips from coming. “James Barnes”

“No, it’s not” His voice took a dangerous edge. “Say it”

“You’re Bucky” I said as the curious side of my mind came back kicking. It was like a war in my head, and I wanted it to be over.

“Yes, and who are you?” He asked again.

“No one” I seethed as anger sparked in me again. “I don’t have a name. I’m an asset”

“Your name is Da–”

“Stop it with that name” I interrupted him by trying to throw a punch at his face. His metal arm shot up yet again and easily grabbed my wrist. I trashed around, but this time, his hold didn’t waver.

“Your name is Dawn. Your parents died when you were 16” He kept going on anyway.

I flinched as more flashes attacked my vision. Spanish essay. Policemen. Bad news. Excruciating sadness.

“Stop” I pleaded as a heavy feeling took over me. Like my lungs were compressed.

“You need to snap out of it” He ordered. “I need you. Rose needs you”

I froze as the name echoed over in over again in my mind.

My sister.

I was thrown once again into my visions defiling one by one in my head, but this time, they were clear as crystal and detailed.

The birth of my sister.

The night my parents died.

The day I met Bucky.

The feeling of the bullet tearing through my lung.

Bucky and I’s last mission.

My eyes shot open as a torrent of information hit me all at once. All my senses went to overdrive as I lost my footing, slipping out of Bucky’s grip. I was hearing everything in the hangar, from the water dropping from the leaking pipe to Bucky’s heavy breathing. I shut my eyes to stop the light from attacking my eyes and I crawled until my back hit a wall.

All the pain from the previous months until Reeves erased my memory.

The starvation, the shocks, the torture.

It all came and went like my memory had been transformed into a roulette. So many chunks from these last years came and went so quickly, I couldn’t even focus on anything but pain. Despite this, I got to manage my breathing, and slowly opened my eyes. Bucky was standing there, looking concerned and afraid.

He came back.

“Dawn?” He asked tentatively.

“Buck” I forced a smile as I let my head fall back on the wall. He came back. It was really him, or so I hoped. Many times I had imagined that moment, but he was too clear to be a trick of my mind. It had to be real.

He didn’t waste time rushing to me and kneeling at my side. “I’m so sorry”

“For what?” I asked. I hated to see him blame himself.

“For not coming sooner” He replied.

“You’re an idiot to have ever come at all” I breathed, now feeling exhausted. I wanted to go to sleep for a whole week.

“I might be” He smiled slightly, pushing a loose strand of hair behind my ear.

“You know they’re waiting behind the door, right?” I said. “None of us will come out ourselves from here”

“Everybody is here, they will back us up–”

“It won’t be enough” I shook my head. “If Reeves gets to one of us, it’s game over. You shouldn’t have come back for me. Now we’re both screwed” I closed my eyes again.

“I made you a promise a while ago, when you were high on pain meds” He started. “I promised I would always have your back. And as far as I know, this counts as having your back”

I took a deep breath and looked down at my hands. “It’s one simple sentence”

“No, we’ll find something else” He tried to compromise. “You just snapped out of it. You are exhausted, and still confused. If you were to be…” He paused and gulped, something close to panic in his eyes. “It could damage even more your mind”

He quickly debated if he should do it, but an explosion sound made up his mind. “When dusk comes the warrior has fallen, but the soldier rises to meet its salvation”

It hit me like a truck, so hard that I had to take a knee. All shaking in my limbs stopped as I pushed myself back on my feet, then slowly looked up at the man in front of me. He was familiar, but I couldn’t place him.

It didn’t matter, he was my handler.

“Soldier?” The pain was quickly wiped from his face and a stoic expression replaced it.

“Ready to comply” I replied.

“Get us out of here alive” He ordered as he walked toward the two discarded guns on the ground. “Shoot anyone who tries to stop us”

I nodded as he offered me the guns. I grabbed them, put the smallest one in my holster and kept the rifle in my hands. I walked to the control panel and rebooted the system. The doors opened automatically when it was done, and I lifted my gun to be ready. My handler did the same thing as about five dozens of guns were pointed our way.

They were ready to take me down, but so was I.

Pairing: oc x Bucky (first person)

Warnings: Strong language, violence, mentions of gore

Word count: 2727

Summary: Dawn’s incredible talent for attracting trouble catches up to her yet again, but this time, it might be more than she ever bargained for…

I hadn’t been able to get sleep last night. Every time I closed my eyes, I was thrown into a weird vision again, including the one my mysterious wound had triggered. It was always the same five settings, and yet, I still had no idea what they were.

It was like they were right out of reach. Every time I tried to cross the fog to discover what it was about, I was pulled out of my sleep. All I could get were five strong, different emotions proper to each vision. Joy, sorrow, renew, pain, and urgency. Oh, and one, single name.

Bucky.

summary: It’s true what they say about the world ENDING -It goes not with a B A N G but with a whisper.   We’ve all lost something,...
caption:
It’s true what they say about the world ENDING -It goes not with a B A N G but with a whisper.

 We’ve all lost something, someone, some part of ourselves that feels impossible to get back.  How can the earth keep turning without the missing?And somewhere, deep within the recesses of the Soul Stone, lies a secret world, a pocket dimension where those who turned to ash in the Snap went.  Two parallel worlds hang in the balance as those trapped inside yearn to break free, and those on the outside search in desperation to break in.  Are you strong enough to join in the fight for not just one dimension, but two? Do you have what it takes to escape an infinity stone?

* SoulStoneHQ is a literate and welcoming post Infinity War roleplay group devoted to world-building and character development. In this group we have two categories, deceased and alive. The deceased characters can interact only with other deceased characters from where they’re trapped inside the Soul Stone’s pocket dimension. The live characters can interact only with live characters from where they have set up shop in the real world. The characters trapped in the Soul World will eventually find their way free of its clutches, but not without hardship and struggle. Do you have what it takes to escape an Infinity Stone?

Main◆Plot◆Characters◆Rules◆Questions
